Callback.Name: SimFLCSPowerTest
Callback.Description: MOMENTARY up position of the FLCS TEST switch on the TEST panel. Depressed when in RAMP to test the 4 branches of the FLCS (when depressed the CADB indicator on the TEST panel should light up, you should also see some light changes on ELEC panel. Pelase refer to the checklists for further information. (New in BMS 4.0) Please Note the MAINT position is not implemented

Callback.Name: SimFLCSReset
Callback.Description: Upper position of the FLCS Reset momentary switch. (Was listed in BMS 2.0 as not implemented and implemented in BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimLeftAPDec
Callback.Description: Toggle - Moves LEFT AP switch Down and once there doesnt toggle back to up

Callback.Name: SimLeftAPDown
Callback.Description: Refers to the leftmost roll mode autopilot control switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the STRG SEL (down) position. If the autopilot is engaged, the jet will turn to a heading that leads towards the currently selected waypoint.

Callback.Name: SimLeftAPInc
Callback.Description: Toggle - Moves LEFT AP switch UP and once there don't toggle back to down

Callback.Name: SimLeftAPMid
Callback.Description: Refers to the leftmost roll mode autopilot control switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the ATT HLD (middle) position. If the autopilot is engaged, the jet will hold the bank angle being commanded by the flight controls at the time when the autopilot was engaged.

Callback.Name: SimLeftAPSwitch
Callback.Description: Full toggle for Left AP switch - this one toggles past the final position back to the other position.

Callback.Name: SimLeftAPUp
Callback.Description: Refers to the leftmost roll mode autopilot control switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the HDG SEL (up) position. If the autopilot is engaged, the jet will turn to match the heading selected in the HSI.

Callback.Name: SimManualFlyupDisable
Callback.Description: Upper position (manual TF FLYUP DISABLE) of the MANUAL TF FLYUP toggle switch - NEW in BMS 4.0

Callback.Name: SimManualFlyupEnable
Callback.Description: Lower position (manual TF FLYUP ENABLE of the MANUAL TF FLYUP toggle switch - NEW in BMS 4.0

Callback.Name: SimRightAPDec
Callback.Description: Toggle - Moves RIGHT AP switch Down and once there doesn't toggle back UP

Callback.Name: SimRightAPDown
Callback.Description: Refers to the rightmost pitch mode autopilot control switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the ATT HOLD (up) position. This command engages the autopilot and causes the autopilot to maintain the pitch attitude commanded by the flight controls at the time the autopilot was engaged. This command only operates if realistic avionics are selected. NB: in the actual F-16 the physical switch for this control is spring-loaded to center and is magnetically held to the up or down position. When the autopilot encounters conditions that prevent its continued operation (excessive pitch or roll that exceed its limits for example), releasing the magnetic hold on this switch centers it and disengages the autopilot. With the current Falcon4 implementation, it would appear that the pitch ATT HOLD position can only be selected if the roll mode switch is in the center position. With the roll mode switch in any other position the pitch mode switch will appear not to go into the down position but in fact it is merely centering again instantly. This may not be correct relative to how the real jet operates. This is under investigation with “authoritative sources” ;-)

Callback.Name: SimRightAPInc
Callback.Description: Toggle - Moves RIGHT AP switch UP and once there doesn't toggle back down

Callback.Name: SimRightAPMid
Callback.Description: Refers to the rightmost pitch mode autopilot control switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the A/P OFF (middle) position. This command disengages the autopilot.

Callback.Name: SimRightAPSwitch
Callback.Description: Full toggle for Right AP switch - this one toggles past the final position back to the other position.

Callback.Name: SimRightAPUp
Callback.Description: Refers to the rightmost pitch mode autopilot control switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the ALT HOLD (up) position. This command engages the autopilot and causes the autopilot to maintain the altitude commanded by the flight controls at the time the autopilot was engaged.

Callback.Name: SimECMConsent
Callback.Description: Refers to the down throw of the HOTAS CMS switch (i.e. towards the pilot). This command enables the ECM transmitter to begin transmitting.

Callback.Name: SimEcmPowerOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the down position (i.e OFF) of the ECM toggle switch of the ECM panel. Notmally that swith is a 3 states switch but in BMS the center STBY position is not implemented.

Callback.Name: SimEcmPowerOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the up position (i.e OPR) of the ECM toggle switch of the ECM panel. Notmally that swith is a 3 states switch but in BMS the center STBY position is not implemented.

Callback.Name: SimECMStandby
Callback.Description: Refers to the right throw of the HOTAS CMS switch. This command places the ECM transmitter in standby mode so that it makes no emissions.

Callback.Name: SimEWSChaffOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the CH switch on the CMDS panel. This command places the switch in the OFF position and disables the use of chaff as part of the countermeasures dispense program.

Callback.Name: SimEWSChaffOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the CH switch on the CMDS panel. This command places the switch in the ON position and enables the use of chaff as part of the countermeasures dispense program.

Callback.Name: SimEWSChaffPower
Callback.Description: Toggles the Chaff power switch ON/OFF on the CMDS panel.

Callback.Name: SimEWSFlareOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the FL switch on the CMDS panel. This command places the switch in the OFF position and disables the use of flares as part of the countermeasures dispense program.

Callback.Name: SimEWSFlareOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the FL switch on the CMDS panel. This command places the switch in the ON position and enables the use of flares as part of the countermeasures dispense program.

Callback.Name: SimEWSFlarePower
Callback.Description: Toggles the Flare power switch ON/OFF on the CMDS panel.

Callback.Name: SimEWSJammerOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the JAMMER switch on the CMDS panel. This command places the switch in the OFF position and prevents the CMDS system from powering on the ECM system if the CMS mode is in SEMI or AUTO modes (see also SimEWS ModeSemi and SimEWSModeAuto). Note this command is not a power off for the ECM transmitter so you can enable ECM manually with the HOTAS controls even if this switch is OFF.

Callback.Name: SimEWSJammerOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the JAMMER switch on the CMDS panel. This command places the switch in the ON position and allows the CMDS system to power on the ECM system if the CMS mode is in SEMI or AUTO modes (see also SimEWS ModeSemi and SimEWSModeAuto). Note this command is not a power on for the ECM transmitter so you can enable ECM manually with the HOTAS controls even if this switch is OFF.

Callback.Name: SimEWSJammerPower
Callback.Description: Toggle the Jammer switch ON/OFF on the CMDS panel

Callback.Name: SimEWSJett
Callback.Description: Refers to the JETT position of the JETT switch of the CMDS, when moved to JETT, all remaining flares are jettisoned at once. (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimEWSJettOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the OFF position of the JETT switch of the CMDS, (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: ExtinguishMasterCaution
Callback.Description: Refers to the MASTER CAUTION reset (pushbutton/indicator) on the left eyebrow.

Callback.Name: SimEject
Callback.Description: Initiates Ejection sequence - must be held a couple seconds to be effective

Callback.Name: SimElecReset
Callback.Description: Refers to the white pushbutton on the ELEC panel. When the ELEC SYS caution light comes ON, this is normally the only way to reset it. (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimEmergencyJettison
Callback.Description: Refers to the Emergency Jettison pushbutton on the Gear panel.

Callback.Name: SimGndJettEnable
Callback.Description: Toggle the ground Jett switch ON/OFF on the gear panel

Callback.Name: SimGndJettOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the GND JETT switch on the landing gear panel. This command places the switch in theOFF position which prevents stores from being jettisoned while on the ground. This commands also prevents the ECM pod from emitting. This command only operates if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimGndJettOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the GND JETT switch on the landing gear panel. This command places the switch in the ENABLE position which allows stores to be jettisoned while on the ground. This commands also allows the ECM pod to emit (this is normally disabled on the ground). This command only operates if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimSilenceHorn
Callback.Description: Refers to the Horn silencer pushbutton on the gear panel.

Callback.Name: SimVMSOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the VOICE MESSAGE SWITCH on the ZEROISE PANEL (right console). This command places the switch in the down or INHIBIT position preventing the VMS from playing audio cue messages (aka “Bitchin’ Betty“).

Callback.Name: SimVMSOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the VOICE MESSAGE SWITCH on the ZEROISE PANEL (right console). This command places the switch in the up or ON position enabling the VMS to play audio cue messages (aka “Bitchin’ Betty“).

Callback.Name: SimWarnReset
Callback.Description: ICP Warn reset (bottom part of the drift/CO - warn reset switch) MOMENTARY

Callback.Name: SimAntiCollOff
Callback.Description: This command places the Anti Collision Light switch in the down (i.e. off) position

Callback.Name: SimAntiCollOn
Callback.Description: This command places the Anti Collision Light switch in the up (i.e. on) position

Callback.Name: SimExtlMasterNorm
Callback.Description: This command places the Master Light switch in the NORM position

Callback.Name: SimExtlMasterOff
Callback.Description: This command places the Master Light switch in the OFF position

Callback.Name: SimLightsFlash
Callback.Description: This command places the Ext Light switch in the FLASH position

Callback.Name: SimLightsSteady
Callback.Description: This command places the Ext Light switch in the STEADY position

Callback.Name: SimWingLightBrt
Callback.Description: This command places the Ext Wing Light switche in the BRT position

Callback.Name: SimWingLightOff
Callback.Description: This command places the Ext Wing Light switche in the OFF position

Callback.Name: SimABReset
Callback.Description: Not implemented - reserved for future use

Callback.Name: SimDecFuelPump
Callback.Description: Toggle DOWN through all Fuel pump knob position (OFF/NORM/AFT/FWD)

Callback.Name: SimDecFuelSwitch
Callback.Description: turns the FUEL QTY SEL knob 1 step counterclockwise

Callback.Name: SimExtFuelTrans
Callback.Description: Refers to the fuel transfer mode control switch on the FUEL QTY SEL panel. This command toggles placement of the switch.

Callback.Name: SimFuelDoorClose
Callback.Description: Refersto the air refuel switch on the FUEL panel. The commands places the switch in the CLOSE position and opens the fuel door with the commensurate side effects (e.g. normal FLCS gains restored).

Callback.Name: SimFuelDoorOpen
Callback.Description: Refers to the air refuel switch on the FUEL panel. The commands places the switch in the OPEN position and opens the fuel door with the commensurate side effects (e.g. suspension of autopilot if engaged, FLCS landing gains engaged).

Callback.Name: SimFuelDump
Callback.Description: Although the F-16 has no fuel dump, this commands allows dumping fuel

Callback.Name: SimFuelTransNorm
Callback.Description: Refers to the fuel transfer mode control switch on the FUEL QTY SEL panel. This command places the switch in the NORM position. In this position the fuel system will empty a centerline external tank before external wing tanks if both tank types are present and have fuel in them.

Callback.Name: SimFuelTransWing
Callback.Description: Refers to the fuel transfer mode control switch on the FUEL QTY SEL panel. This command places the switch in the NORM position. In this position the fuel system will empty a centerline external tank after external wing tanks if both tank types are present and have fuel in them.

Callback.Name: SimIncFuelPump
Callback.Description: Toggle UP through all Fuel pump knob position (OFF/NORM/AFT/FWD)

Callback.Name: SimIncFuelSwitch
Callback.Description: turns the FUEL QTY SEL knob 1 step clockwise

Callback.Name: SimMasterFuelOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the MASTER switch on the FUEL panel. This command places the switch in the OFF position. This prevents fuel from flowing to the engine.

Callback.Name: SimMasterFuelOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the MASTER switch on the FUEL panel. This command places the switch in the ON position. This enables fuel to flow to the engine.

Callback.Name: SimToggleMasterFuel
Callback.Description: Toggle (ON/OFF) command for Master Fuel switch

Callback.Name: AFAlternateGear
Callback.Description: refers to the ALT GEAR handle on the left aux console - extends the gear pneumatically when hydraulic failed.

Callback.Name: AFAlternateGearReset
Callback.Description: refers to the white pushbutton on top of the ALT GEAR handle which allows to retract the gear after an alternate extension, if hydraulic pressure is available

Callback.Name: AFGearDown
Callback.Description: Refers to the landing gear control handle This command places the handle in the “down” position. If the gear is not already down and locked and there are no landing gear faults, the gear is lowered. This command only operates with Realistic Avionics selected in the game.

Callback.Name: AFGearUp
Callback.Description: Refers to the landing gear control handle This command places the handle in the “up” position. If the gear is not already up and there are no landing gear faults, the gear is stowed. This command only operates with Realistic Avionics selected in the game.

Callback.Name: SimHmsOff
Callback.Description: The real HMCS knob features and ON/OFF switch at the full CCW position and this callback refers to that button when moved to the fullest CCW position. It powers down the HMCS (new BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHmsOn
Callback.Description: The real HMCS knob features and ON/OFF switch at the full CCW position and this callback refers to that button when moved out of the full CCW position. It powers up the HMCS (new BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHmsSymWheelDn
Callback.Description: The HMCS knob can be implemented with an analogue axis or keystrokes. When implemented with keystrokes this callback decreases the brightness of the HMCS, corresponds to turning the HMCS knob counterclockwise. (new BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHmsSymWheelUp
Callback.Description: The HMCS knob can be implemented with an analogue axis or keystrokes. When implemented with keystrokes this callback increases the brightness of the HMCS, corresponds to turning the HMCS knob clockwise. (new BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHsiCourseDec
Callback.Description: Refers to the HSI CRS knob. This callback turns the knob counterclockwise in 5° increment

Callback.Name: SimHsiCourseInc
Callback.Description: Refers to the HSI CRS knob. This callback turns the knob clockwise in 5° increment

Callback.Name: SimHsiCrsDecBy1
Callback.Description: Same as abobe but in 1° increment (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHsiCrsIncBy1
Callback.Description: Same as abobe but in 1° increment (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHsiHdgDecBy1
Callback.Description: Same as abobe but in 1° increment (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHsiHdgIncBy1
Callback.Description: Same as abobe but in 1° increment (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHsiHeadingDec
Callback.Description: Refers to the HSI HDG knob. This callback turns the knob counterclockwise in 5° increment

Callback.Name: SimHsiHeadingInc
Callback.Description: Refers to the HSI HDG knob. This callback turns the knob clockwise in 5° increment

Callback.Name: SimHSIModeDec
Callback.Description: callback to turn HSI mode knob Counterclockwise and stop at the last position

Callback.Name: SimHSIModeInc
Callback.Description: callback to turn HSI mode knob clockwise and stop at the last position

Callback.Name: SimStepHSIMode
Callback.Description: Full toggle for the HSI mode knob. Toggles to all positions and back to initial

Callback.Name: SimDriftCO
Callback.Description: Latching side of the DRIFT CO toggle switch on ICP (UP position)

Callback.Name: SimHUDAltDown
Callback.Description: Toggle HUD Radar ALT switch Down

Callback.Name: SimHUDAltUp
Callback.Description: Toggle HUD Radar ALT switch UP

Callback.Name: SimHUDBrightness
Callback.Description: Full toggle (back and forth) for HUD brightness (BMS 2.0)

Callback.Name: SimHUDDED
Callback.Description: Full toggle back and forth for the DED/PFL switch

Callback.Name: SimHUDDEDDown
Callback.Description: Moves the DED/PFL switch down and doesn't toggle back (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHUDDEDUp
Callback.Description: Moves the ded/pfl switch up and doesn't toggle back (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimHUDFPM
Callback.Description: Full toggle for the Pitch ladder switch. Toggle all three positions and back to initial.

Callback.Name: SimHUDOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the on/off switch that is part of the thumb wheel control for HUD brightness on the ICP. If you roll the thumb wheel downwards, there is an on/off switch at the end of travel in that direction. Clicking past this switch in the downwards direction turns off the HUD power preventing the unit from displaying HUD symbology. This command is only for the OFF part of the button.

Callback.Name: SimHUDOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the on/off switch that is part of the thumb wheel control for HUD brightness on the ICP. If you roll the thumb wheel downwards, there is an on/off switch at the end of travel in that direction. Clicking past this switch in the upwards direction turns on the HUD power enabling the unit to display HUD symbology. Remainder of the thumbwheel’s travel controls symbology brightness. This command is only for the ON part of the button

Callback.Name: SimHUDPower
Callback.Description: Initial Toggle ON/OFF of the HUD. Refers to the lowest position of the BRT left bottom wheel on the ICP. Before being able to set brightness of the HUD, it has to be turned ON. Real wheels has a switch at the beginnng of the course. When using a analogue control (pot) for HUD brightness, the SIMHUDPower has to be used and programmed on the pot switch.

Callback.Name: SimHUDRadar
Callback.Description: Full toggle of the HUD RADAR Altitude switch. It toggles back and forth to all position continuously

Callback.Name: SimHUDScales
Callback.Description: Full toggle back and forth for the HUD scale switch

Callback.Name: SimHUDVelocity
Callback.Description: Toggle The HUD velocity back and forth to all position and back

Callback.Name: SimHUDVelocityDown
Callback.Description: Toggle HUD velocity switch Down and once there doesn't toggle back to Up

Callback.Name: SimHUDVelocityUp
Callback.Description: Toggle HUD velocity switch UP and once there doesn't toggle back to down

Callback.Name: SimPitchLadderDown
Callback.Description: Toggle Down the pitch ladder switch and once there doesn't toggle back

Callback.Name: SimPitchLadderUp
Callback.Description: Toggle Up the pitch ladder switch and once there doesn't toggle back

Callback.Name: SimRetDn
Callback.Description: Refers to the DEPR RET wheel on the top right of the ICP. decrease the backup RETICLE for Manual bombing

Callback.Name: SimReticleSwitch
Callback.Description: Full toggle (back and forth) for the reticle switch

Callback.Name: SimReticleSwitchDown
Callback.Description: Moves the DEPR RET switch DOWN

Callback.Name: SimReticleSwitchUp
Callback.Description: Moves the DEPR RET switch UP

Callback.Name: SimRetUp
Callback.Description: Refers to the DEPR RET wheel on the top right of the ICP. Increase the backup RETICLE for Manual bombing

Callback.Name: SimSymWheelDn
Callback.Description: This command is for the Brightness control on the left side of the ICP.It can also be assigned to an analogue axis. This key function is equivalent to a right mouse click on the thumb wheel and it decreases the brightness of the color used for the various elements of HUD symbology (see also the SimHUDBrt* commands for multiplier effect). There are 6 levels of brightness. The lowest level is basically going to blank all the symbology. In previous versions of Falcon4, at the lowest level brightness the HUD was powered off for you. This is not true in BMS: the Sym Wheel commands merely set level. Use the SimHUDPower* commands to turn the HUD on an off.

Callback.Name: SimSymWheelUp
Callback.Description: This command is for the Brightness control on the left side of the ICP. It can also be assigned to an analogue axis. This key function is equivalent to a left mouse click on the thumb wheel and it increases the brightness of the color used for the various elements of HUD symbology (see also the SimHUDBrt* commands for multiplier effect). There are 6 levels of brightness. The lowest level is basically going to blank all the symbology. In previous versions of Falcon4, at the lowest level brightness the HUD was powered off for you. This is not true in BMS: the Sym Wheel commands merely set level. Use the SimHUDPower* commands to turn the HUD on an off.

Callback.Name: SimICPAA
Callback.Description: push button Master Mode AA on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPAG
Callback.Description: push button Master Mode AG on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPALOW
Callback.Description: push button #2 - ALOW (ALTITUDE LOW) subpage on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPCom1
Callback.Description: push button override Mode COM1 on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPCom2
Callback.Description: push button override Mode COM2 on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPCrus
Callback.Description: push button #5 - CRUS (CRUISE) subpage on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPDEDDOWN
Callback.Description: ICP DCS switch DOWN (4 way switch)

Callback.Name: SimICPDEDSEQ
Callback.Description: ICP DCS switch RIGHT to SEQ (4 way switch)

Callback.Name: SimICPDEDUP
Callback.Description: ICP DCS switch UP (4 way switch)

Callback.Name: SimICPEIGHT
Callback.Description: push button #8 FIX subpage on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPFAck
Callback.Description: Left eyebrow F-ACK (Fault acknowledge) pushbutton. When depressed, display fault on PFD screen. NO FAULTS, ALL SYS OK is displayed when there's no failure detected.

Callback.Name: SimICPIFF
Callback.Description: push button override Mode IFF on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPLIST
Callback.Description: push button override Mode LIST on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPMark
Callback.Description: push button #7 - MARK subpage on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPNav
Callback.Description: push button Master Mode NAV on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPNext
Callback.Description: pushbutton arrow up (NEXT) on ICP (left of DCS)

Callback.Name: SimICPNINE
Callback.Description: push button #9 A-Cal subpage on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPPrevious
Callback.Description: pushbutton arrow down (PREVIOUS) on ICP (left of DCS)

Callback.Name: SimICPResetDED
Callback.Description: ICP DCS switch LEFT to RTN (4 way switch)

Callback.Name: SimICPStpt
Callback.Description: push button #4 - STPT (steerpoint) subpage on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPTILS
Callback.Description: push button #1 - T-ILS (tacan-ILS) subpage on ICP

Callback.Name: SimICPZERO
Callback.Description: push button #0 - M-SEL (Mode SELECT) subpage on ICP

Callback.Name: SimIFFCodeSwitchHold
Callback.ShortDescription: Putting the switch momentarily in this position prevent automatic deletion of mode 4 keys when LG has been cycled and power is removed from IFF

Callback.Name: SimIFFCodeSwitchZero
Callback.ShortDescription: Zeroize mode 4 keys if held for 2s

Callback.Name: SimIFFEnableM1M3
Callback.ShortDescription: Enable Mode 1 & Mode 3 responses with the codes set in the backup rotaries

Callback.Name: SimIFFEnableM3MS
Callback.ShortDescription: Enable Mode 3 and Mode S response, mode S being not implemented ATM

Callback.Name: SimIFFEnableOff
Callback.ShortDescription: On equipped jets, enable control of modes when the C&I switch is in backup. Positions

Callback.Name: SimIFFMasterEmerg
Callback.ShortDescription: Respond with EMERGENCY codes to mode 1 (70)/2(7777)/3(7700), normal response mode C, can interrogate but interrogated codes cannot be changed

Callback.Name: SimIFFMasterLow
Callback.ShortDescription: Respond to interrogation above a certain detection threshold, roughly half max effective distance, can interrogate

Callback.Name: SimIFFMasterNorm
Callback.ShortDescription: Respond to all detected interrogations, can interrogate

Callback.Name: SimIFFMasterStby
Callback.ShortDescription: Power on, do not respond, can interrogate

Callback.Name: SimIFFMode4ReplyAlpha
Callback.ShortDescription: Reply to interrogations with key A

Callback.Name: SimIFFMode4ReplyBravo
Callback.ShortDescription: Reply to interrogation with key B

Callback.Name: SimAltPressDec
Callback.Description: Refers to the pressure knob on the altimeter. This callbacks turns the knob counterclockwise in 1mb or 0.01 in of Hg depending on the option (mb or inHg) in the BMSconfig (New BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimAltPressInc
Callback.Description: Refers to the pressure knob on the altimeter. This callbacks turns the knob clockwise in 1mb or 0.01 in of Hg depending on the option (mb or inHg) in the BMSconfig (New BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimDigitalBUP
Callback.Description: Upper position (DIGITAL BACKUP) of the DBU toggle switch. Newly implemented in BMS 4.0 but was in BMS2.0 as not implemented

Callback.Name: SimDigitalBUPOff
Callback.Description: Lower position (OFF) of the DBU toggle switch. New in BMS 4.0

Callback.Name: SimFLTBIT
Callback.Description: FLCS BIT switch (magnetic) upper position is magnetically held while the BIT is performed. At the end of the BIT, the switch snaps back into the OFF position. (Was in BMS2.0 as not implemented, newly implemented in BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimDedBrightness
Callback.Description: Set DED brightness knob (3-state for now)

Callback.Name: SimDedBrightnessCCW
Callback.Description: Set DED brightness knob (3-state for now)

Callback.Name: SimDedBrightnessCW
Callback.Description: Set DED brightness knob (3-state for now)

Callback.Name: SimInstrumentLight
Callback.Description: Toggle back and forth for Instrument light knob

Callback.Name: SimInstrumentLightCCW
Callback.Description: Turns the INSTRUMENT Light knob counterclockwise. IE turning the Instrument backlight OFF

Callback.Name: SimInstrumentLightCW
Callback.Description: Turns the INSTRUMENT Light knob clockwise. IE turning Instrument backlight ON

Callback.Name: SimInteriorLight
Callback.Description: Toggle back and forth for Interior light knob

Callback.Name: SimInteriorLightCCW
Callback.Description: Turns the INT LIGHT knob counterclockwise. IE turning the Interior light OFF

Callback.Name: SimInteriorLightCW
Callback.Description: Turns the INT LIGHT knob clockwise. IE turning Interior light ON

Callback.Name: SimMalIndLights
Callback.Description: Pushbutton depress action . When depressed, all VMS sounds and cockpit lights are ON and remains On as long as the button is depressed.

Callback.Name: SimMalIndLightsOFF
Callback.Description: Pushbutton release action. Mal&ind press to test btn (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimDLOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the DL power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and disables power to the data link receiver.

Callback.Name: SimDLOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the DL power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables power to the data link receiver.

Callback.Name: SimDLPower
Callback.Description: Toggle the Datalink power switch ON/OFF

Callback.Name: SimEngContPri
Callback.Description: Refers to the PRI (PRIMARY) position of the ENG CONT switch on the ENG & JET START panel. Place the engine in PRIMARY mode which is the normal operating mode. (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimEngContSec
Callback.Description: Refers to the SEC Secondary position of the ENG CONT switch on the ENG & JET START panel. Place the engine in SECONDARY mode which inhibits AB (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimEpuGenTest
Callback.Description: Momentary switch on TEST panel to test EPU - (new in BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimEpuOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the EPU mode control on the EPU panel. This command places the switch in the OFF (down) position. Prevents the EPU from running or terminates EPU if running.

Callback.Name: SimEpuOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the EPU mode control on the EPU panel. This command places the switch in the ON (up) position. The EPU will start running if EPU fuel is still available.

Callback.Name: SimEpuToggle
Callback.Description: Toggle EPU switch from OFF to NORM to ON.

Callback.Name: SimFCCOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the FCC power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and disables power to the fire control computer.

Callback.Name: SimFCCOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the FCC power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables power to the fire control computer.

Callback.Name: SimFCCPower
Callback.Description: Toggle the FCC power switch ON/OFF

Callback.Name: SimFCROff
Callback.Description: Refers to the FCR swtich on the SNSR PWR panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and disables power for the fire control radar which prevents it from operating.

Callback.Name: SimFCROn
Callback.Description: Refers to the FCR swtich on the SNSR PWR panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables power for the fire control radar which is required for it to operate.

Callback.Name: SimGPSOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the GPS power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and disables power to the GPS receiver.

Callback.Name: SimGPSOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the GPS power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables power to the GPS receiver.

Callback.Name: SimGPSPower
Callback.Description: Toggle the GPS power switch ON/OFF

Callback.Name: SimILSDown
Callback.Description: Refers to the power switch on the ILS volume rotary knob in the AUDIO2 panel. This command turns off the ILS radio receiver; ILS will not provide steering cues when the receiver is turned off (NOTE: the receiver is on at startup by default).

Callback.Name: SimILSUp
Callback.Description: Refers to the power switch on the ILS volume rotary knob in the AUDIO2 panel. This command turns on the ILS radio receiver; ILS will not function unless the receiver is turned on (NOTE: the receiver is on at startup by default).

Callback.Name: SimJfsStart
Callback.Description: Toggle JFS switch but since the JFS shuts down automatically, it can be considered as JFS to START. (unless you want to abort JFS start which is not a good idea!) Note: this command should be used to map to the action of putting the switch in the START2 position; do not also map it to the movement of the switch back to center/off position (in other words, treat it more like a push button). This accounts for the fact that the real jet uses a magnetically captured switch that holds the bat in the START2 position until the engine comes alive (55% RPM during normal ground start) at which point the JFS engine is powered down and this switch self-centers to off.

Callback.Name: SimLaserArmOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the LASER switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the ARM position. Regardless of the MASTER ARM switch position, the command preventsthe laser designator from firing.

Callback.Name: SimLaserArmOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the LASER switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the ARM position. Provided that the MASTER ARM switch is in the ARM position, the command makes the laser designator ready to fire on command from the fire control computer.

Callback.Name: SimLeftHptOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the LEFT HDPT switch on the SNSR PWR panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and disables the power to the left hand fuselage hardpoint. .

Callback.Name: SimLeftHptOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the LEFT HDPT switch on the SNSR PWR panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables the power to the left hand fuselage hardpoint.

Callback.Name: SimMasterArmDown
Callback.Description: Moves master arm swich down and once there doesn't toggle back to UP (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimMasterArmUp
Callback.Description: Moves master arm swich up and once there doesn't toggle back to DOWN (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimMaxPower
Callback.Description: Not implemented - reserved for future use

Callback.Name: SimMFDOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the MFD power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and disables power to the mutifunction displays.

Callback.Name: SimMFDOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the MFD power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables power to the mutifunction displays.

Callback.Name: SimMFDPower
Callback.Description: Toggle the MFD power switch ON/OFF

Callback.Name: SimMPOToggle
Callback.Description: Note: in reality, the physical switch for this control is a momentary spring-loaded action. This means it should be held in the OVRD position to be effective. The SimMPOToggle command does not work this way and should be considered as a simulation workaround for non cockpit builder. Cockpit builders with actual switches should use the one below.

Callback.Name: SimObogsBit
Callback.Description: Momentary switch in Up position for testing Oxygen QTY (new in BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimOverHeat
Callback.Description: Pushbutton on TEST panel to test Overheat caution lights - (new in BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimPickle
Callback.Description: Normally refers to the stick pickle button, but duplicated here as it is also suitable for the ALT REL pushbutton on the MISC panel.

Callback.Name: SimRADARGainDown
Callback.Description: Beware - There is NO corresponding MFD button name implemented right now.

Callback.Name: SimRADARGainUp
Callback.Description: Beware - There is NO corresponding MFD button name implemented right now.

Callback.Name: SimRightHptOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the RIGHT HDPT switch on the SNSR PWR panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and enables the power to the right hand fuselage hardpoint. In particular, the laser designator will not function if the control is not in the ON position.

Callback.Name: SimRightHptOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the RIGHT HDPT switch on the SNSR PWR panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables the power to the right hand fuselage hardpoint. In particular, the laser designator will not function if the control is not in the ON position.

Callback.Name: SimSeatOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the ACES II seat arming level on the left side of the ejection seat. This command places the lever in the up or SAFE position. The ejection seat is disabled.

Callback.Name: SimSeatOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the ACES II seat arming level on the left side of the ejection seat. This command places the lever in the down or ARMED position. The ejection seat is enabled.

Callback.Name: SimSlapSwitch
Callback.Description: refers to the countermeasure release pushbutton located above the throttle rail. This button when depressed release EWS PRGM #5 as set in the DTC or UFC (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimSMSOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the SMS power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and disables power to the stores management system.

Callback.Name: SimSMSOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the SMS power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables power to the stores management system.

Callback.Name: SimSMSPower
Callback.Description: Toggle the SMS power switch ON/OFF

Callback.Name: SimStepMasterArm
Callback.Description: Toggle master arm switch state round and round

Callback.Name: SimUFCOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the UFC power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position and disables power to the up front controls (including ICP).

Callback.Name: SimUFCOn
Callback.Description: Refers to the UFC power switch in the AVIONICS POWER panel. This command places the switch in the up or ON position and enables power to the up front controls (including ICP).

Callback.Name: SimUFCPower
Callback.Description: Toggle the UFC power switch ON/OFF

Callback.Name: SimRFNorm
Callback.Description: Refers to the RF switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the NORM (up) position. RF transmissions from systems that are emitters and that are active are enabled.

Callback.Name: SimRFQuiet
Callback.Description: Refers to the RF switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the QUIET (middle) position. RF transmissions from systems that are emitters and that are active are reduced. In particular, the main APG-68 radar set does not transmit in this mode.

Callback.Name: SimRFSilent
Callback.Description: Refers to the RF switch on the MISC panel. This command places the switch in the SILENT (down) position. All RF transmissions suppressed including APG-68, CARA and TFR transmitters.

Callback.Name: SimRFSwitch
Callback.Description: Toggle RF switch state back and forth

Callback.Name: OTWBalanceIVCvsAIDown
Callback.Description: Balances AI vol against IVC volume (to be mapped to the small vol UHF knob) (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: OTWBalanceIVCvsAIUp
Callback.Description: Balances AI vol against IVC volume (to be mapped to the small vol UHF knob) (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimAud1Com1Gd
Callback.Description: Refers to the GD position of the COM1 Mode knob (under COM1 volume) on AUDIO 1 panel. In this mode, COM1 is tuned to GUARD if the CNI switch is in UFC (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimAud1Com1Sql
Callback.Description: Refers to the SQL position of the COM1 Mode knob (under COM1 volume) on AUDIO 1 panel. Used for normal radio operations (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimAud1Com2Gd
Callback.Description: Refers to the GD position of the COM2 Mode knob (under COM2 volume) on AUDIO 1 panel. In this mode, COM2 is tuned to GUARD if the CNI switch is in UFC (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimAud1Com2Sql
Callback.Description: Refers to the SQL position of the COM2 Mode knob (under COM2 volume) on AUDIO 1 panel. Used for normal radio operations (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimAuxComBackup
Callback.Description: Refers to the BACKUP position of the CNI knob. In this position, BACKUP panels are active

Callback.Name: SimAuxComUFC
Callback.Description: Refers to the UFC position of the CNI knob. In this position the UFC (Up Front Controller) is the primary system and all BACKUP panels are ineffective.

Callback.Name: SimBupUhfFuncDec
Callback.Description: Moves the BUP UHF Function knob CCW (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimBupUhfFuncInc
Callback.Description: Moves the BUP UHF Function knob CW (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimBupUhfGuard
Callback.Description: Refers to the GUARD position of the mode knob of the backup UHF panel. Please note this panel is functionnal only when the CNI switch is in BACKUP. In this position, the backup UHF send and receives on UHF Guard frequency. (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimBupUhfModeDec
Callback.Description: Moves the BUP UHF Mode knob CCW (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimBupUhfModeInc
Callback.Description: Moves the BUP UHF Mode knob CW (BMS 4.0)

Callback.Name: SimBupUhfPreset
Callback.Description: Refers to the PRESET position of the mode knob of the backup UHF panel. Please note this panel is functionnal only when the CNI switch is in BACKUP. In this position, the backup UHFoperates according to the set channel displayed above as a two digit channel (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimComm1PowerOff
Callback.Description: The COM1 volume knob features a ON/OFF button on the fully counterclockwise position. This callback turns the COM1 radio OFF When using an analogue axis for COM1 volume, this only callback is required to turn the radio OFF after decreasing it's volume with the analogue device. (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimComm1PowerOn
Callback.Description: The COM1 volume knob features a ON/OFF button on the fully counterclockwise position. This callback turns the COM1 radio ON. When using an analogue axis for COM1 volume, this only callback is required to turn the radio ON before increasing it's volume with the analogue device. (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimComm2PowerOff
Callback.Description: The COM2 volume knob features a ON/OFF button on the fully counterclockwise position. This callback turns the COM2 radio OFF When using an analogue axis for COM2 volume, this only callback is required to turn the radio OFF after decreasing it's volume with the analogue device. (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimComm2PowerOn
Callback.Description: The COM2 volume knob features a ON/OFF button on the fully counterclockwise position. This callback turns the COM2 radio ON. When using an analogue axis for COM2 volume, this only callback is required to turn the radio ON before increasing it's volume with the analogue device. (BMS4.0)

Callback.Name: SimCycleBandAuxComDigit
Callback.Description: Cycle UP band from X to Y to X on the aux comms thumbwheel, please note, there's no decrease for this one as it's a two states.

Callback.Name: SimCycleCenterAuxComDigit
Callback.Description: Cycle UP center digit from 0 to 9 on the aux comms thumbwheel

Callback.Name: SimCycleLeftAuxComDigit
Callback.Description: Cycle UP left digit from 0 to 9 on the aux comms thumbwheel

Callback.Name: SimCycleRadioChannel
Callback.Description: This command has maps to the UHF preset channel selector knob on the UHF panel. This command has bee updated to match correct behavior. In this version of the game, this command will change only the UHF channel and then if and only if the CNI switch on the AUX COMM panel is in the backup position. There is no backup control for changing VHF radio channel so if the ICP is not working you are out of luck on that one.

Callback.Name: SimCycleRightAuxComDigit
Callback.Description: Cycle UP right digit from 0 to 9 on the aux comms thumbwheel

Callback.Name: SimDecCenterAuxComDigit
Callback.Description: Cycle DOWN center digit on the aux comms thumbwheel

Callback.Name: SimDecLeftAuxComDigit
Callback.Description: Cycle DOWN left digit on the aux comms thumbwheel

Callback.Name: SimDecRadioChannel
Callback.Description: Can be used to map to the radio preset channel selector encoder knob on the UHF. This command does the inverse of the SimCycleRadioChannel command which is to say it changes the channel but cycling through the 8 choices in reverse order. This command will change only the UHF channel and then if and only if the CNI switch on the AUX COMM panel is in the backup position. There is no backup control for changing VHF radio channel so if the ICP is not working you are out of luck on that one. This command only operates with realistic avionics selected.

Callback.Name: SimDecRightAuxComDigit
Callback.Description: Cycle DOWN right digit on the aux comms thumbwheel

Callback.Name: SimStepComm1VolumeDown
Callback.Description: COM1 volume can be implemented with an analogue device (pot) or keystrokes. When using keys, you need to use this callback for decreasing COM1 volume. Corresponds to moving the COM1 volume counterclockwise in 8 steps.

Callback.Name: SimStepComm1VolumeUp
Callback.Description: COM1 volume can be implemented with an analogue device (pot) or keystrokes. When using keys, you need to use this callback for increasing COM1 volume. Corresponds to moving the COM1 volume clockwise in 8 steps.

Callback.Name: SimStepComm2VolumeDown
Callback.Description: COM2 volume can be implemented with an analogue device (pot) or keystrokes. When using keys, you need to use this callback for decreasing COM2 volume. Corresponds to moving the COM2 volume counterclockwise in 8 steps.

Callback.Name: SimStepComm2VolumeUp
Callback.Description: COM2 volume can be implemented with an analogue device (pot) or keystrokes. When using keys, you need to use this callback for increasing COM2 volume. Corresponds to moving the COM2 volume clockwise in 8 steps.

Callback.Name: SimStepIntercomVolumeDown
Callback.Description: Adjust Intercom volume down - Intercom manages all sounds normally heard through helmet. This can also be assigned to an analogue axis.

Callback.Name: SimStepIntercomVolumeUp
Callback.Description: Adjust Intercom volume up - Intercom manages all sounds normally heard through helmet. This can also be assigned to an analogue axis.

Callback.Name: SimStepMissileVolumeDown
Callback.Description: Refers to the MSL volume of the AUDIO1 panel. This knob can be implemented with an analogue device or keystrokes. Please note: unlike COM1&2 volumes, there is no ON/OFF switch at the full CCW position. Use this callback to decrease MSL volume in 8 steps, moving the MSL knob counterclockwise

Callback.Name: SimStepMissileVolumeUp
Callback.Description: Refers to the MSL volume of the AUDIO1 panel. This knob can be implemented with an analogue device or keystrokes. Please note: unlike COM1&2 volumes, there is no ON/OFF switch at the full CCW position. Use this callback to increase MSL volume in 8 steps, moving the MSL knob clocwkise

Callback.Name: SimStepThreatVolumeDown
Callback.Description: Refers to the THREAT volume of the AUDIO1 panel. This knob can be implemented with an analogue device or keystrokes. Please note: unlike COM1&2 volumes, there is no ON/OFF switch at the full CCW position. Use this callback to decrease THREAT volume in 8 steps, moving the THREAT knob counter clocwkise

Callback.Name: SimStepThreatVolumeUp
Callback.Description: Refers to the THREAT volume of the AUDIO1 panel. This knob can be implemented with an analogue device or keystrokes. Please note: unlike COM1&2 volumes, there is no ON/OFF switch at the full CCW position. Use this callback to increase THREAT volume in 8 steps, moving the THREAT knob clocwkise

Callback.Name: SimTACANAATR
Callback.Description: Refers to the TACAN domain selection switch on the AUX COMM panel. This command places the switch in the AATR position. TACAN channels refer to air stations only. Note that the game only implements two positions for this switch; there is no separate functionality for the REC (receive only) position.

Callback.Name: SimTACANTR
Callback.Description: Refers to the TACAN domain selection switch on the AUX COMM panel. This command places the switch in the TR position. TACAN channels refer to ground stations only. Note that the game only implements two positions for this switch; there is no separate functionality for the REC (receive only) position.

Callback.Name: SimToggleAuxComAATR
Callback.Description: Toggle AUX COMM TACAN switch AA to AATR and back

Callback.Name: SimToggleAuxComMaster
Callback.Description: Toggle CNI switch from CNI to backup and back

Callback.Name: SimToggleUHFMaster
Callback.Description: In SP3 this command erroneously changed the source of radio channel programming from the UFC to the backup controls on the UHF panel. BMS corrects this problem and now the selection of input controls for UHF channel selection is made via the CNI switch on the AUX COMM panel as per the real system.

Callback.Name: SimEWSRWROff
Callback.Description: Refers to the RWR switch on the CMDS panel. This command places the switch in the OFF position and prevents the RWR system from providing inputs to the CMDS. See also SimEWSModeAuto.

Callback.Name: SimEWSRWROn
Callback.Description: Refers to the RWR switch on the CMDS panel. This command places the switch in the ON position and enables the RWR system to provide inputs to the CMDS. See also SimEWSModeAuto.

Callback.Name: SimEWSRWRPower
Callback.Description: Toggles RWR switch ON/OFF on the CMDS panel

Callback.Name: SimRWRHandoff
Callback.Description: Refers to the pushbutton/indicator labelled HANDOFF on the TWP (threat warning Prime)

Callback.Name: SimRwrPower
Callback.Description: Refers to the pushbutton/indicator labelled POWER on the threat warning AUX on the left AUX console. It powers the RWR

Callback.Name: SimRWRSetGroundPriority
Callback.Description: Refers to the pushbutton/indicator labelled LOW ALTITUDE on the threat warning AUX on the left AUX console. Alow Low alltitude threat to be prioritized on RWR

Callback.Name: SimRWRSetNaval
Callback.Description: Refers to the pushbutton/indicator labelled NAVAL on the TWP (threat warning Prime)

Callback.Name: SimRWRSetPriority
Callback.Description: Refers to the pushbutton/indicator labelled PRI on the TWP (threat warning Prime)

Callback.Name: SimRWRSetSearch
Callback.Description: Refers to the pushbutton/indicator labelled SEARCH on the threat warning AUX on the left AUX console. Allows Search Symbol to be displayed on RWR

Callback.Name: SimRWRSetTargetSep
Callback.Description: Refers to the pushbutton/indicator labelled TGT SEP on the TWP (threat warning Prime)

Callback.Name: SimRWRSetUnknowns
Callback.Description: Refers to the pushbutton/indicator labelled UNK on the TWP (threat warning Prime)

Callback.Name: AFCanopyInc
Callback.Description: Toggles canopy up and down . At this time we do not have two positions callbacks for the canopy. The canopy switch is actually placed under the yellow spider in the left sidewall. The spider is the switch guard. In BMS cockpit, the yellow spider is the switch. Closing the spider actually actions the switch.

Callback.Name: AFDecFlap
Callback.Description: Decreases flaps settings for non F-16 aircraft

Callback.Name: AFDecLEF
Callback.Description: Decreases leading edge flaps settings for non F-16 aircraft

Callback.Name: AFDragChute
Callback.Description: Refers to some version of the F-16 featuring a dragchute (MLU) this callbacks refers then to the guarded chute switch on the MISC panel and deploy the parabrake -

Callback.Name: AFFullFlap
Callback.Description: Sets Full flaps for non F16 aircraft

Callback.Name: AFFullLEF
Callback.Description: Sets Full leading edge flaps for non F16 aircraft

Callback.Name: AFIncFlap
Callback.Description: Increases flaps settings for non F-16 aircraft

Callback.Name: AFIncLEF
Callback.Description: Increases leading edge flaps settings for non F-16 aircraft

Callback.Name: AFNoFlap
Callback.Description: Sets Flaps fully retracted for non F16 aircraft

Callback.Name: AFNoLEF
Callback.Description: Sets Leading edge flaps fully retracted for non F16 aircraft

Callback.Name: SimAltFlaps
Callback.Description: TOGGLE ALT FLAPS UP & DOWN (relevant to F-16) Toggle command. Manually extends the trailing edge flaps and sets the flight control gain settings to the landing mode values. A second operation of the command releases the TEFs to FLCS control. NB: presuming no faults, the TEFs will retract by themselves at above 370 knots CAS although they will extend again if speed then decays below 370 knots and the switch is still in the EXTEND position.

Callback.Name: SimAltFlapsExtend
Callback.Description: Refers to the ALT FLAPS switch in the FLT CONTROL panel. This command places the switch in the EXTEND position. Manually extends the trailing edge flaps and sets the flight control gain settings to the landing mode values. NB: presuming no faults, the TEFs will retract by themselves at above 370 knots CAS although they will extend again if speed then decays below 370 knots and the switch is still in the EXTEND position. This command only operates if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimAltFlapsNorm
Callback.Description: Refers to the ALT FLAPS switch in the FLT CONTROL panel. This command places the switch in the NORM position. Operation of the command releases the TEFs to FLCS control.

Callback.Name: SimCATI
Callback.Description: Refers to the STORES CONFIG switch in the landing gear panel. This command places the switch in the CAT I position. This command only operates if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimCATIII
Callback.Description: Refers to the STORES CONFIG switch in the landing gear panel. This command places the switch in the CAT III position. This command only operates if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimCATSwitch
Callback.Description: Toggle CAT switch on Gear panel

Callback.Name: SimHookDown
Callback.Description: This command refers to the HOOK switch on the landing gear panel. This command places the switch in the DOWN position. The hook on the aircraft is lowered to the deployed position. This will also set the hook caution panel light and master caution light will come on as a result also. This command will only operate if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimHookUp
Callback.Description: This command refers to the HOOK switch on the landing gear panel. This command places the switch in the UP position. The hook on the aircraft is raised to the stowed position. This will also clear the hook caution panel light and master caution light. This command will only operate if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimLEFAuto
Callback.Description: Refers to the LE Flaps switch on the FLT CONTROL panel. The command places the switch in the AUTO position. LE Flaps are unlocked from their current position and control is returned to the FLCS.

Callback.Name: SimLEFLock
Callback.Description: Refers to the LE Flaps switch on the FLT CONTROL panel. The command places the switch in the LOCK position. LE Flaps are locked into their current position.

Callback.Name: SimLEFLockSwitch
Callback.Description: TOGGLE for LEF (LOCK/AUTO) relevant to F-16 Locks the leading edge flaps in current position and illuminates the “LE FLAPS” caution indicator. This command is a toggle so operating it again releases the LEFs to FLCS control and clears the caution panel light.

Callback.Name: SimParkingBrakeDec
Callback.Description: Refers to the PARKING BRAKE switch on the landing gear panel. This command places the switch in the up or on position which engages the parking brake. The command does nothing if the jet is moving. NB: the game only implements two positions for this control not three as in the real jet. This command only operates if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimParkingBrakeInc
Callback.Description: Refers to the PARKING BRAKE switch on the landing gear panel. This command places the switch in the down or OFF position which disengages the parking brake. NB: the game only implements two positions for this control not three as in the real jet. This command only operates if realistic avionics are selected.

Callback.Name: SimTEFCMDDec
Callback.Description: CKPIT: F-18 FLAP Switch - Step Down

Callback.Name: SimTEFCMDInc
Callback.Description: CKPIT: F-18 FLAP Switch - Step Up

Callback.Name: SimTrimAPDISC
Callback.Description: Refers to the AP DISC switch in the MANUAL TRIM panel. This command places the switch in the DISC position. Disables manual HOTAS trim hat controls and prevents autopilot engagement. Manual trim controls on this panel are still active however. NOTE: please be careful with the name of this one when you add it to the .key file – last four letters are upper case and that is significant!

Callback.Name: SimTrimAPNORM
Callback.Description: Refers to the AP DISC switch in the MANUAL TRIM panel. This command places the switch in the NORM position. Enables manual HOTAS trim hat controls and allows autopilot engagement. Manual trim controls on this panel are active also.

Callback.Name: SimTrimNoseDown
Callback.Description: The MAN TRIM wheels can be implemented both with keystrokes or analogue values. When implemented with keystrokes, this callbacks refers to the right part (NOSE DOWN) of the bottom right trim wheels for PITCH axis trim. Please note, HOTAS trims have their own callbacks.

Callback.Name: SimTrimNoseUp
Callback.Description: The MAN TRIM wheels can be implemented both with keystrokes or analogue values. When implemented with keystrokes, this callbacks refers to the left part (NOSE UP) of the bottom right trim wheels for PITCH axis trim. Please note, HOTAS trims have their own callbacks.

Callback.Name: SimTrimRollLeft
Callback.Description: The MAN TRIM wheels can be implemented both with keystrokes or analogue values. When implemented with keystrokes, this callbacks refers to the upper position (L WING DN) of the top left trim wheels for AILERON trim. Please note, HOTAS trims have their own callbacks.

Callback.Name: SimTrimRollRight
Callback.Description: The MAN TRIM wheels can be implemented both with keystrokes or analogue values. When implemented with keystrokes, this callbacks refers to the lower position (R WING DN) of the top left trim wheels for AILERON trim. Please note, HOTAS trims have their own callbacks.

Callback.Name: SimTrimYawLeft
Callback.Description: The MAN TRIM wheels can be implemented both with keystrokes or analogue values. When implemented with keystrokes, this callbacks refers to the upper position (YAW TRIM L) of the bottom left trim knob for RUDDER trim. Please note, there is no RUDDER HOTAS trims

Callback.Name: SimTrimYawRight
Callback.Description: The MAN TRIM wheels can be implemented both with keystrokes or analogue values. When implemented with keystrokes, this callbacks refers to the lower position (YAW TRIM R) of the bottom left trim knob for RUDDER trim. Please note, there is no RUDDER HOTAS trims

Callback.Name: SimAVTRSwitch
Callback.Description: Toggle AVTR switch to all three positions including going from OFF to ON again

Callback.Name: SimAVTRSwitchDown
Callback.Description: Moves the AVTR switch down (does NOT jump from full down to full up) BMS 4.0

Callback.Name: SimAVTRSwitchOff
Callback.Description: Refers to the flight recorder mode switch on the AVTR panel. This command places the switch in the OFF (down) position. The AVTR recorder will not run.

Callback.Name: SimAVTRSwitchUp
Callback.Description: Moves the AVTR switch up (does NOT jump from full up to full down) BMS 4.0

Callback.Name: SimOxySupplyToggle
Callback.Description: Toggle breathing sounds ON/OFF. This is a workaround to replace an old config line in BMS config. Breathing sounds can now be activated within the cockpit.

Callback.Name: SimThrottleIdleDetent
Callback.Description: Badly named after the CUTOFF release. This callback was created to overcome the lack of physical cutoff range on the throttle course. Depending on using the CUTOFF idle code in BMS config, this key should be used to simulating moving the throttle out of OFF to IDLE at engine start.
